intro: Scleria subintegriloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bulrush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikelets that are typically green or brown in color. Scleria subintegriloba thrives in wet or marshy habitats and is often found in freshwater wetlands. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic ecosystems.
